page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: {Hillside Farm }has 85 acres of which,10 acres are of barley,3 acres of rootcrops which are kale,swede and potatoes and 72 acres of grass.There are 34 dairy Friesians and Guernseys.They produce on average 500 litres of milk a day between them.The milk is stored in a bulk tank and is carried away by a tanker.The tanker carries the milk from the farm to the milk factory at Camborne.The milk is used mostly for{dried milk}and also {butter.}The Friesians cost Â£600 for good milking cows.Guernseys cost Â£350 to Â£400. The Friesians weigh about 458kg to 509kg,and the Guernseys weigh about 407kg.Friesians give more milk than Guernsey cows but it is not so rich in cream.
